docs.title: ✏️ CadifyLine
docs.text: The CadifyLine formula draws a straight line between two points on the Cadify Sketcher canvas within Excel.

docs.title: 📌 What It Does
docs.text: When you enter this function into a cell, a line is created on the corresponding drawing area defined by the CadifySheet() function. The line is positioned precisely in millimeters, using the lower-left corner of the Sketcher area as the origin.

docs.title: 🧾 Syntax
docs.text: =CadifyLine(lineName, startX, startY, endX, endY, style, cadifySheetName, zOrder)

docs.title: 🧮 Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description lineName A unique name for this line (used for updates). startX, startY Starting point (in mm) from the lower-left origin. endX, endY Ending point (in mm) from the same origin. style Line style and color (e.g., "RedDash", "BlackSolid", "Suppress" to hide). cadifySheetName The name provided in the related CadifySheet() call. zOrder Drawing order (higher values are on top).

docs.title: ✅ Example
docs.text:
=CadifyLine("MainLine", 0, 0, 100, 0, "BlackSolid", "SketchA", 1)

This draws a 100mm horizontal black line from the origin on the sheet named "SketchA".

docs.title: 🔁 Behavior
docs.text:
• If the same lineName is reused, the shape is updated (not duplicated).
  • Using the style "SUPPRESS" will remove or hide the shape.
  • Coordinates are measured in millimeters, converted automatically to Excel shape units.

docs.title: 🔒 Notes
docs.text:
• CadifySheet() must be set up on the same worksheet to define the drawing area.
  • This function automatically tracks changes and updates/redraws only when needed.

docs.title: Launching the Task Pane
docs.text:
1. Open Excel.
  2. Use the Cadify Ribbon to show the Task Pane.
  3. The Task Pane appears on the right.

docs.title: First Steps
docs.text:
• Register a new account on caify.gratis
  • Log in to your Cadify account.
  • Use the Task Pane to open, create, or manage Cadify products.

docs.title: Task Pane & CadifyLightMenu
docs.text: The Task Pane is the main user interface for the Cadify Light Excel Add-in.

docs.title: File Menu
docs.text:
• Open Raw Open a raw product from Dropbox. Enabled only if a user is logged in and no product is currently open.

  • Open Published Open a published product from Dropbox. Enabled only if a user is logged in and no product is currently open.

  • Save Save the current product to local and cloud storage. Enabled only if a product is open.

  • Save as (Raw) Create first raw if no product is currently open. Save a copy of the current product as a new raw product.

  • Publish Publish or republish the current product to the cloud. Button label changes based on product type. Enabled only if a product is open.

  • Delete Raw(s) Delete one or more raw products from Dropbox.

  • Close Close the current product, with options to save changes. Enabled only if a product is open.

docs.title: Tools Menu
docs.text: • General Information Edit general product attributes (e.g., name, SKU). Enabled only if a product is open.

docs.title: User Profile
docs.text:
• Login Open login dialog. Visible only if no user is logged in.

  • [User Name] A button shows current user's name, with Logout sub menu option.

  • Logout: Log out and clear credentials.

docs.title: Visual and Interactive Features
docs.text:
• Dynamic Colors: Menu backgrounds and text colors adapt to the current theme.
  • Disabled State: Disabled items are grayed out.

docs.title: ✨ Sketcher Overview
docs.text:
Cadify Light allows you to draw precise geometry in Excel using formulas.

You enter values into a Sketcher input table, and Excel shapes are created automatically. All coordinates are in millimeters, measured from the lower-left corner of the defined Sketcher area.

docs.title: Features:
docs.text:
• Live shape updates
  • Line styles and color selection
  • Excel-friendly table interface

docs.title: TaskPaneView Deep Dive
docs.text: This section provides a detailed, technical look at what a user can do on the Task Pane in the Cadify Light Excel Add-in.

docs.title: TaskPaneView Structure
docs.text:
• TaskPaneView is a WPF UserControl that hosts the CadifyLightMenuView.
  • The TaskPaneViewModel is the main data context, managing user state, product state, and all menu commands.
  • The menu is always visible at the top of the pane, and adapts to user/product state.

docs.title: 1. Parameter and Control Management
docs.text:
• Visualize Cadify Controls:

  • On the Task Pane the Cadify Controls are shown same as it will be display in the web shop after publishing the product.

  • Add/Edit/Delete Cadify Controls:

  • Context menus and dialogs allow adding, editing, or deleting product parameters (Cadify Controls).
  • Editing opens a modal dialog for parameter details.
  • Deleting removes the control from the product and updates Excel.
